qas.question: Which treaty was Australia's first military alliance outside of the British Commonwealth?
Which areas were involved in the ANZUS Treaty?

answers.text: Australia, New Zealand and the United States

qas.question: Where was the signing of the ANZUS Treaty held in 1951?
What does the acronym SEATO stand for?

answers.text: South East Asia Collective Defence Treaty

qas.question: Which group is a counterpart to NATO?

answers.text: the South East Asia Collective Defence Treaty (SEATO)

qas.question: Which treaty was Austrialia's first military alliance outside of NATO?

plausible_answers.text: Australia, New Zealand and the United States

qas.question: Which areas were involved with the NATO Treaty?
Where was the signing of the NATO Treaty held in 1951?

plausible_answers.text: South East Asia Collective Defence Treaty

qas.question: What does the acronym did Percy Spender sign?

plausible_answers.text: the South East Asia Collective Defence Treaty (SEATO)

qas.question: Which group is a counterpart to External Affairs?

context: In 1951, during the early stages of the Cold War, Menzies spoke of the possibility of a looming third world war. The Menzies Government entered Australia's first formal military alliance outside of the British Commonwealth with the signing of the <a0_0><b5_0>ANZUS Treaty<b5_0/><a0_0/> between <a1_0><b6_0>Australia, New Zealand and the United States<b6_0/><a1_0/> in <a2_0><b7_0>San Francisco<b7_0/><a2_0/> in 1951. External Affairs Minister Percy Spender had put forward the proposal to work along similar lines to the NATO Alliance. The Treaty declared that any attack on one of the three parties in the Pacific area would be viewed as a threat to each, and that the common danger would be met in accordance with each nation's constitutional processes. In 1954 the Menzies Government signed <a4_0><b9_0>the <a3_0><b8_0>South East Asia Collective Defence Treaty<b8_0/><a3_0/> (SEATO)<b9_0/><a4_0/> as a South East Asian counterpart to NATO. That same year, Soviet diplomat Vladimir Petrov and his wife defected from the Soviet embassy in Canberra, revealing evidence of Russian spying activities; Menzies called a Royal Commission to investigate.
